sentences.sContent: If you could ever figure out how to market this you’d make a fortune.
sentences.sCn: 如果能想出办法来推销这个东西，你就发财了。

sentences.sContent: They plan to market the toy for children aged 2 to 6.
sentences.sCn: 他们打算向二至六岁的儿童推销这种玩具。

sentences.sContent: ...By raising relative demand for clean energy sources，a carbon price would also help align the market return to clean-energy innovation with its social return...
...the development of handicraft industry promoted the development of market economy and urbanization...
...In America the kitchen market is now worth $170 billion...
...but I have to say that it's more important to get experience in different types of market research to find out exactly what you're interested in...
...the Chinese government established Shenzhen special economic zone to pilot the socialist market economy...
...Although the global market is still dominated by US and UK...
...laptops and desktops have made up a huge part of the market and driven innovation...
...The market demand for electronic devices is now either declining or not growing as fast as before...
...and the market has not had time to choose a winner yet as this is still very new...

synos.tran: 市场；行情；股票市场；市面；[贸易]集市；销路；商店

phrases.pCn: 股票市场；证券市场；股票交易
房地产市场；不动产市场
地产市场；房地产市场；物业市场
市场机制；市场调节作用

words.tran: 市场的；可销售的；有销路的
[贸易] 市场商人；市场营销人员
出售；在市场上进行交易；使…上市（market的ing形式）

trans.tranOther: to try to persuade people to buy a product by advertising it in a particular way, using attractive packages etc
